name: Beef Stir Fry
description: Asian-style beef stir fry quickly cooked over high heat with colorful vegetables and savory sauce.

instructions.instruction: Marinate beef strips with 1 tbsp soy sauce and cornstarch.
Mix remaining soy sauce, oyster sauce, sesame oil, and chicken broth for sauce.
Heat wok or large skillet over very high heat.
instructions.tip: Wok should be smoking - this is critical for flavor.

instructions.instruction: Add marinated beef in batches, let sear 1-2 minutes without stirring.
instructions.tip: Don't overcrowd - it will steam instead of sear.

instructions.instruction: Stir and cook 1 more minute. Remove to plate.
Add remaining oil to same wok.
Add carrots and broccoli, stir-fry 2 minutes.
Add bell peppers and snow peas, cook 1-2 minutes.
Add garlic and ginger, cook 30 seconds.
Return cooked beef and add prepared sauce.
Toss continuously 1-2 minutes until sauce thickens.
Add most of green onions and toss.
Serve over rice or noodles, garnish with sesame seeds and remaining green onions.

tips: Freeze beef 20 minutes before slicing - much easier to cut thin.
Prep all vegetables before starting - stir fry cooks fast.
No wok? Use wide-bottomed deep skillet.
Use low-sodium soy sauce for healthier version.
storageInfo: Refrigerate up to 3 days. Reheat in wok or skillet.
servingSuggestion: Serve over jasmine rice or egg noodles.
variations: Chicken: Use chicken breast instead of beef.
Vegetarian: Use tofu and more vegetables.
